$SPY $TSLA $AAPL $AMD $TWTR 

My thoughts on the stock mkt this week  .... 

Don't fight the Fed. That was the topic of my very first Game Plan of 2022 sent out to members (SEE BELOW). After all, we have been yelled at every single time we have tried to doubt the stock market for over a decade - "Don't fight the Fed!". Or, just buy the dip!

As I pointed out first week of January, the game has changed. Yet, retail investors continue to act as a sponge, absorbing institutional selling on all the rallies  because the institutions understand the new game. Same playbook you and I are staring at, but they are implementing and the retail investor refuses to even pick it up and read it. 

My new Game Plan goes out on Sunday. For those interested in joining,  email me at jessielivermore1929@gmail.com 

In over 25 years of trading, this may be one of the most important qtrs of earnings I've been apart of.  What companies can we trust to deliver? I will examine. 

Enjoy your weekend ✌️

$SPY ....Some perspective for y'all.... Also this "crash" or whatever that just happened today....  You all need to check the history of actual corrections on this thing then how long they take how far down they go.....📚It didn't lose anything it literally just gave back that ridiculous move from yesterday after terrible terrible news... Most vertical 2 year move in history and this is all you've given back and you think the market has corrected 😂 $TSLA $AAPL $ARKK $UVXY 🍀

body: $AAPL anyone else think we’ll see $120 over the next year?

$SPY Yeah... go ahead and cancel that idea... $FB $TWTR $AAPL 

MARK Zuckerberg’s Meta has revealed that it will take a large amount of the earnings made in its Horizon Worlds metaverse.

A staggering 47.5% of sales made in Horizon Worlds will go to Meta and the rest to the user.

According to CNBC, Meta confirmed these plans to take almost a 50% cut from users.

There’s a 30% hardware platform fee if you’re selling virtual assets through the Meta Quest Store.

Then, there’s a 17.5% fee on top of this for sales made in Horizon Worlds.

Some people are finding the revelation confusing because Meta, formerly Facebook, once criticized Apple for taking a similar 30% cut from creators. 
 https://www.the-sun.com/tech/5119541/mark-zuckerberg-metaverse-tax-meta/

links.title: Fury over Mark Zuckerberg's 'metaverse tax' as he demands HALF of all earnings

A staggering 47.5% of sales made in Horizon Worlds will go to Meta and the rest to the user. According to CNBC, Meta confirmed these plans to take almost a 50% cut from users.
